Entries.default:
Several figures slink toward you from the surrounding streets.

Leading them is an orlan with blood-red fur and long, sharpened nails. She sniffs the air.

"I smell that Mataru richling's perfume on you. You got something I want. Give me the Cornett of Waves."

The thugs creep toward you, hands on their weapons.
"Back off."
"You must be the one Dereo originally hired."
[Attack] "Let's get this over with."
"Not without the Cornett of Waves." She inches closer, brandishing a blade.
"I've fought worse. You'll make easy pickings."
"Listen, Dereo didn't send me after some trinket. He sent me to get rid of you."
She forces a laugh. "You think you can chase us away?"
"Those sound like the words of a man at the end of his rope." She holds her blade at neck level and makes a slicing motion.
Entries.female: "Those sound like the words of a woman at the end of her rope." She holds her blade at neck level and makes a slicing motion.

Entries.default: "Don't listen to him. He's just trying to scare us off."
Entries.female: "Don't listen to her. She's just trying to scare us off."

Entries.default: "Dereo wanted to keep this theft a secret. You're a loose end."
A few of the thugs shuffle their feet nervously.
"Come to think of it, that does sound like Dereo..."

"Enough! Or I'll gut you lot alongside this fool."

Ateira spins to glare at her people.
"Or the one who just bested the queen's bodyguard."

Ateira runs a sharpened nail along her blade, glancing from you to the other thugs.

At last, she sheathes her weapon.

"Fine. But I see you again, and things'll go differently, I promise."

She storms away, and the other thugs hesitantly follow.
She growls with frustration and sheathes her weapon.
"You're an idiot. The cornett is just a shell."
"Besides, you're here, aren't you?" She jabs her blade toward you.
"You really think he'd trust some cheap thugs with a real treasure?"
"Then what would he want with it?" One hand finds her hip. The other keeps her blade pointed at you.
"Frame someone. Anyone with a stolen relic like that would be in trouble with the Palace."
"It's a relic of Ondra. See the runes?"
"You know, I've heard his name among the Príncipi. If Dereo were going to send anyone..."
Entries.female: "You know, I've heard her name among the Príncipi. If Dereo were going to send anyone..."

Entries.default: "I heard what he did to that vithrack in Delver's Row. I'm not crossing him."
Entries.female: "I heard what she did to that vithrack in Delver's Row. I'm not crossing her."

Entries.default: "I heard what he did to Ernezzo in Delver's Row. I'm not crossing him."
Entries.female: "I heard what she did to Ernezzo in Delver's Row. I'm not crossing her."

Entries.default: But the thug shakes his head.
But the thug shakes his head.
"I dunno about you, Ateira, but I'll take him at his word."
Entries.female: "I dunno about you, Ateira, but I'll take her at her word."

Entries.default: "Don't believe it, boss. This one's the softest [player class] in Deadfire."
"I guess you've never heard of a spur-and-snare con, have you?"

The advancing thugs hesitate.

She turns to them, her filed teeth bared in a scowl.
"That can't be - why else would Dereo send us for it?" Her furred face is a maelstrom of irritation and confusion.
"Boss, he thinks a lot straighter'n you." The thug scratches his head.
Entries.female: "Boss, she thinks a lot straighter'n you." The thug scratches his head.

Entries.default:
"Then I guess you think you've saved me a mess, that it?" She pauses, her eyes darting from you to the currently empty streets as she thinks.

At last, she sheathes her weapon.
"You must be the one Dereo originally hired."
"Ain't hired if you don't get paid. Way I see it, Dereo just gave me a lead." Her smile reveals a row of filed teeth.
"Ain't hired if you don't get paid. Way I see it, Dereo just gave me a lead." Her smile reveals a row of filed teeth.
"What if I hand it over and we go our separate ways?"
"I can't have you going back to Dereo." She shakes her head sadly.
"How should I know?"

She shakes her head. "One way or another, I'll find out."

She raises her hand, and her thugs charge.

"I see 'em. Makes me think this shell is worth something, after all."

She raises her hand, and her thugs charge.
They take a few tentative steps back.
"Come on, there's easier targets..."
"And I'm gonna sell that thing on my own."
"And I'm gonna sell that thing on my own."
"Fye, surely ye mean the ninnypate whit blundered the job!"
"Hold on, I thought he hired some dummy that bungled everything."

"Now lass. No need to sour that pretty face on account of us achieving what you done cocked up."

Serafen smiles, but his hands hover near his weapons.
"I ain't failed just yet! Not when I got you cornered."
"I ain't failed just yet! Not when I got you cornered."
"Boss, this one's a Bleak Walker. They don't make idle threats." The cipher's voice quavers.

"Means we've got no choice."

Ateira raises her weapon with a shaking hand.
"I knew it! Dereo figured you were gonna cross him, and now he's sent the Steel Garrote after us!"
"We'll take our chances." She grins wickedly.
"Yep. And you'll leave Neketaka forever if you know what's good for you."
"How about you make this easy on us both and get out of here?"
"Sounds like someone ain't so confident."
